values:
A friend posted this on his LJ and I've decided to take up the challenge. I'll keep the same caveats and restrictions. Here's what he posted:

" The first five people to respond to this post will get something made by me! My choice. For you.

This offer does have some restrictions and limitations:
- I make no guarantees that you will like what I make!
- What I create will be just for you.
- It'll be done this year.
- You have no clue what it's going to be. It may be a story. It may be poetry. I may draw or paint something. I may bake you something and mail it to you. Who knows? Not you, that's for sure!
- I reserve the right to do something extremely strange.

The catch? Oh, the catch is that you have to put this in your journal as well. We all can make stuff!"

-WF

President Elect Obama chatted with the President of Poland. The Poles are not overly concerned about Russian threats to target Poland should the missile defense system be built, they are more worried the system won't be built.  Afterwards the Polish put out a press release that said Obama had reeiterated the US's commitment to installing hte missile defense system. Shortly thereafter Obama issued a release saying  no, he was sticking to his campaign commitments, without actually spelling those commitments out. So now if the system isn't built, Obama will appear as if he is weak in the face of Russian threats, which is really what the Russian announcement following his election was intended to accomplish.

The rumor that he might get Hillary as Secretary of State would be very helpful for him if true. That choice would suggest a more hawkish administration than it appears so far.

-WF

So Russia is putting in new missiles aimed at the missile defense site in Poland. he told Poland that in any potential conflict they would be targeted first. The President of Russia announces this hours after the Obama victory.  Think they would have done that if McCain won? Oh and he placed the blame for the World financial crisis on the US and accused the US of supporting barbarism and aggression by Georgia against Ossetia. On the other hand he did send a telegram congratulating Obama and expressing confidence that the new Administration will treat Russia with the proper respect. If Obama doesn't tax the snot of the wealthy, we might get out of this recession in 2 years, and maybe it won't be a full blown depression. had McCain won we certainly would have gotten out of it in 2 years. The very real threats and dangers to our sovereignty and security though are emboldened by this new administration. He needs to deal with this threat decisively and boldly. Anything else will encourage our enemies.

Should be an interesting 4 years.

It does not get any tougher than this for a civil libertarian.

www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/washingtondc/la-na-pumpkin31-2008oct31,0,2115760.story

These are, in some cases, people who have served time for their crimes. The idea that they are still being curtailed and subject to punishment without due process bothers  me. So does the idea that children could be at risk. Convictions that are only held when they are convenient are really not convictions though. If child molesters are really incapable of controlling their urges then a conviction for child molestation should carry a life sentence. The problem with that of course is that it makes a perverse sense then for a molester to kill their victims and reduce the chance of being caught. This is why the hierarchy of punishments is the way it is (with the exception of draconian punishments for certain drug offenses which are both racists and unfair and lead to increased violence amongst drug-dealers). We don't want to encourage criminals to compound their crimes, and we want deterrents to escalation. We also want to minimize the likelihood that any child will be made to suffer this way. We also want to respect the rights of citizens as enumerated in the Constitution. These measures clearly ignore the rights of these former felons, at least the ones who have paid their debt to society. The ones who are on parole could be reasonably expected as a condition of their parole to be subject to these codicils. The biggest problem i have with this is the pre-emptive nature of it. The presumption of guilt is anathema to our form of government.  We can't make "exceptions" because in "just this one area" it's ok to compromise our liberties. The real safeguard is how we raise and care for our children. Don't send them out alone to trick or treat at any age, and personally go with them until they are old enough to understand and flawlessly execute the proper etiquette for such an activity. No one's liberties should be abridged because parents are being lazy and want the state to deal with issues they should deal with themselves.

-WF

PS On the other hand if something like that happened to a nephew or niece of mine, god help the perpetrator because there is no one on earth who will be able to.

There are three things I have always loved and never understood, painting, music and women. -Bernard de Fontenelle

Well said Bernie, well said.

Two members of a group of people that you think of pejoratively are waiting at a bus stop.

When a bus pulls up and opens the door, one of the two people leans inside and asks the bus driver:''Will this bus take me to 5th Avenue?''

The bus driver shakes his head and says,''No, I'm sorry.''

At this the other person leans inside, smiles, and asks: ''Will it take ME?''

Today was a bizarre day, and it's not over yet.

My tire went flat on the highway.

I have a service that's supposed to help me when things like that happen. I called them. They discovered that the usual process does not apply to problems on I-684. So instead the State police send a privately contracted service. They showed up thinking that I had run out of gas and completely incapable of towing my car as I had requested. Instead, he filled up my busted ass tire with air and told me to quickly get off the highway so I could call someone else to fix my problem.  I kid you not. 

I got off at the next exit (my tire deflating as I went) and found a gas station. Gas stations as most of you know, are largely convenience stores that also sell gasoline. They used to be places where you could actually get service for your car. Not so much now. What made it more interesting is that the people at the gas station could not in any way direct me to someplace that serviced cars. After several failed attempts to use the service that was supposed to help me with such things (it's from Verizon, I don't have AAA, but that's going to change in the very near future) I bought a can of Fix-A-Flat and used it. Then I drove up Route 22 back to Brewster and a service station that I remembered as having been there years ago. Luckily it still was. There I encountered the first truly helpful people of the entire experience.  

I recall a contrasting experience once with Ambersong's car and the nice folks at AAA. I'm convinced that AAA is the way to go and yes, my tire is now fine and the car is great and I'm at work (I was around three hours late). later this week I'm buying a spare tire and throwing out the stupid doughnut (it's got a hole in it anyway). I'm also going to put a tire iron in the trunk as well.

-WF

A man decided to march in the holy crusades. Concluding that his wife should wear a chastity belt while he is gone, he locks up her nether regions and gives the key to his best friend. He tells him, "If I do not return within four years, unlock my wife and set her free to live a normal life."

So, the husband leaves on horseback and about a half hour later, he sees a cloud of dust behind him. He waits for it to come closer and sees his best friend. "What's wrong," he asks.

"You gave me the wrong key!"

http://www.cnn.com/2008/HEALTH/10/23/ms.treatment/index.html?imw=Y&iref=mpstoryemail

This might be a very big deal. Keep your fingers crossed.

Word on the street is that the Blackberry Storm will cost $199.00 for people who have Verizon like me... oh yeah baby.

-WF

It's starting to feel like I'm the only person working today.

On the bright side I'm reaching a lot of consultants at home today.

-WF

Ralph said "Light is the first consideration of painters. There is no object so foul that intense light will not make it beautiful." I'm not sure I agree, but it is an interesting idea for a philosophical doctrine. Other related aphorisms would be "Honesty is the best policy," "Secrets only help the bad guys," and of course the fundamentally sound "The truth hurts, but the truth shall set you free."

In consideration of this. I'd appreciate replies that include 1 statement that is inarguably true. Not opinion, but factually accurate. The kicker is though, try to make it interesting.

"I shot a man in the woods and don't know if he lived or died." Would be interesting, but is not true. "There are 13 stripes on the American Flag." Is true but not interesting. "My mother was clinically dead on an operating table in the early 60's and during a perceived visitation with a deceased relative was told something she is convinced she did not know." is both true and interesting.

Have at it, while your at it, comment on the idea of Ralph's quote as a philosophical basis.

-WF

PS if you know who Ralph is without looking it up, double bonus points.

It's been way too long since I've seen you and the Lenny's. Hope you have a great day.

-WF
I know it's selfish but I'm really  hoping this isn't someone I know.

* Grab the nearest book.
* Open the book to page 56.
* Find the fifth sentence.
* Post the text of the sentence in your journal along with these instructions.
* Don't dig for your favorite book, the cool book, or the intellectual one: pick the CLOSEST.

"Avoid sounding pompous or flippant by matching what you say to what you've done."
So Verizon and Rimm are coming out with a new phone, the Blackberry Storm. It's sweet. I'm getting one unless the price is beyond ludicrous.

Stop bringing up the Keating Five and The Weathermen. Both sides need to concentrate on the issues. If there was any criminal activity alert the appropriate enforcement authorities and let it go. But Ayers wasn't convicted and no charges resulted from the investigation of the Keating thing, so both sides should concentrate on issues. If there's something other than scare tactics here, let the proper authorities deal with it.

I felt like I was slipping into a depression the past couple of days. I know the proximate cause and it's not something I have the ability to change (well not something I have the ability to change AND stay out of jail anyway) so my options are let it get to me, or rise above it. When I thought of that I remembered that I float. Of course if I keep dieting I may not float the way I used to.

Cake is good, but so is pie. 

Sarah Palin is going to exceed expectations tonight. I'm wondering how Biden is going to dance around his own contention earlier in the year that Obama isn't qualified to be President. If I were Gov. Palin I'd hit that note pretty hard. He also inexplicably in September said that Hillary would have been as good a choice or a better choice than he was for VP. Since she was never vetted for the position (therefore never seriously considered) he's saying Obama ignored the best potential pick. The problem is the undermining of his running mate's judgement and qualification. Palin's abyssmal performance in the Katie Couric interview (so bad she made Katie seem like a serious journalist) not withstanding, she should do better tonight than she has in anything since the convention. For Biden the challenge is to come off as an informed Obama supporter without being made to look like a lying hypocritical career politician who has been in Washington for 35 years. That task is made more dificult because he actually is a lying hypocritical career politician who has been in Washington for 35 years. For Palin the challenge is not seeming like she's totally out of her league. If she bring s the same preparation and talent she bought to the Convention she could pummel Biden tonight. Of course they could BOTH flop, which oddly favors Biden. People are more forgiving of a man who is known for sticking his foot in his mouth stuffing his buster browns past his molars than a woman who is still largely unknown doing the same.

So, I'm continuing the diet and getting to the gym. If I'm going to be relegated to second string I'm going to make that choice seem as ridiculous as I possibly can.

This post brought to you by the Society for the Prevention of Turtle Shell Abuse.

By the way, what was Gonzo? Kermit was a frog, Fozzie was a Bear, Ralph was a dog, Miss Piggy was a ... well, you get the idea. What the hell was Gonzo? We know he was sexually attracted to chickens...  but he doesn't really look like a rooster, so what the heck was he?
The double lightning bolts are back for tomorrow... everywhere.

The little icon on my weather indicator for Friday has been geting progressively worse as it draws closer. Not just for here, but for Ambersong and my old apartment and where we're moving her stuff to. Yesterday it was filled with rain drops and had a lightning bolt in it. Today it has two lightning bolts and the rain drops look more like rain bullets. I thought for a second I saw frogs and locusts in the picture. Saturday should be better though, so there's that.

-WF

While I'm not averse to Congress working all weekend. I'm pretty sure I won't like whatever comes out of this. I do apprreciate McCain's point of view that he and Senator Obama should be doing their current jobs to the best of their ability instead of trying to get a new job. Senator Obama does seem to be on board the non-partisan train for this one too, so that's good. What's amusing to me is that the candidate best suited to lead during this type of crisis was sidelined pretty early. This is exactly the kind of thing Chris Dodd should be good at, and yet we have these two instead. The truth is though that whatever is going to happen will be well on its way to happening before January 20. Disaster or no, the time to set a course is right now, not in the middle of the upcoming winter. Really the time was 7 or 8 years ago... but it's too late for that. Next year is looking like a great year to buy a house, if you can get any credit.

-WF

When the Appropriations Bill that included the "Bridge to Nowhere" l was presented to the Senate, an Amendment was offered that  would strip those funds from that prtoject and instead use them to repair badly damaged bridges in Louisiana in the aftermath of Katrina. Both Biden and Obama voted against that amendment (which did nothing else, just take the money from the Bridge to Nowhere and use it instead to help the people of Louisiana after the hurricane). They also both subsequently voted for the Appropriations bill itself, which included earmarks for both of their home states that they had sought. John McCain doesn't make earmark requests and didn't vote against that amendment nor did he vote for the appropriations bill. Yet Biden and Obama harp on Sarah Palin  because before she was governor she supportd the bridge, but after she was governor she opposed it. They're berating her for eventually getting it right while they both got it completely wrong. Schmucks.

-WF
The Ansel Adams Photo of the day...  one of my favorites actually.

So...  $700,000,000,000,000.00 divided by 300,000,000 people...  that's about $2,300,000.00 each. The moment this abomination is signed. Not including interest, every man woman and child in the United States will owe $2,300,000.00.

Great.

-WF

Just overheard two women here at work talking about me from around the corner:

Woman 1: Is it just me or is (my name) looking a lot better since he got here?

Woman: No, you're right he is. It's like he gets better every week...

Then I came around the corner...  moments like that make life worth living. I don't think I'm looking all that good today, but it was a nice little boost.

The last time I weighed what I weigh today I was a bartender deciding which of 3 life paths to take. I could go back to school at NYU Film school (even had a Bartending job secured through a friend in NYC), I could take an offered job of being a paid Ski patroller in both Colorado and Argentina or I could take a job as an IT Recruiter. Not long after that I walked into a new comic/gaming store a friend had recommended and the girl behind the counter talked me into starting a weekly D&D game at the store. She also told me about a game her brother and his friends were starting that was a "live" version of D&D.  I eventually was the best man at that girl's wedding and I bought the company that ran the game her brother and his friends started, and I met all you wonderful people.

As my weight drops it's kind of like a time machine for me. My ultimate goal is my college weight of 195. That could take more than a year from now to achieve, but it's not unrealistic. For my height, build and age a weight of 190 is recommended. I won't be as muscular as I was then (when I was young my legs and abdomen were ripped, my upper body less so though)but I'll be in much better shape than I am now, that's for sure.

I don't regret the decision I made. It led me to being the best man at that wedding, it lead me to more that a couple of amazing women who I've loved in that time and it led me to a career that enabled me to live on an 80 Acre horse farm; take a friend who was in a bad time in his life to Switzerland; I met Tristan; and helped arrange for several children to personally meet Santa Claus. 

I'm looking forward to not being "the fat man" anymore. I've got more energy and except for certain nights when a specific stressor causes me insomnia, I'm sleeping better and my general health is greatly improved. My depression was probably weight related as well, or at least the depth of it must have been. It's more surmountable now. My real regret is that I didn't commit this strongly to the weight loss when it might have mattered more, and seemed less like a consolation.

-WF

I've been here 6 weeks, I've had 5 closings. That's pretty good in this business. The last two are short term, but the people getting the work are happy to have it. And the client is happy to have them. Sometimes this is a real pleasure.

The Doctor finally talked with me. It was a good conversation but it was long overdue. She's not 100% but she's improved. They are releasing her today and upping her anti-seizure dosage. This is a medication that makes her sleep a lot. So the longer term plan is to find a suitable alternative medication that doesn't have that side effect. First however they need to see how she is on the same  medication at the correct dosage. It's going to be a process, and that process starts with her coming home tonight. She specifically asked about one of you and she has the presence of mind to want to thank everyone who called, stopped by or even wished her well through my brothers or me. 

It's been a very stressful week, yet I stayed on the slim  fast. Forty-three pounds lost. It's starting to be obvious in the way some of my clothes hang. Which means they must have been seriously too tight at some point, sorry about that everyone. I'm going to wait 15 more pounds before the celebratory clothes shopping spree. 

How many of play RB on Xbox? I'm thinking of treating myself to RB2 next week. My RB disc got trashed, so I need to replace it and my DW6 disc. Though GTA IV is fine and in fact my GTA partner in crime and I have only 1 mission left. Hopefully we'll finish that soon.

Thanks everyone for the good thoughts both posted and e-mailed, I really do appreciate it. It's not over yet, but at least this part of it is.

First... LL Cool J has a line of clothing... for young suburban white teens...   sold at Sears.  No, seriously.


Second, another sleepless night looks to be beginning. Slept great last night though, all things considered. I will make a sincere effort though after I post this.

Mom has the nurses convinced she's better, because they all ask the same questions and she's figured out by body languager and inflection what answers thet want. It took me less than three minutes to realize she's not as better as they think she is. Doctor still hasn't spoken with me. He's getting seriously harassed tomorrow.

Told my niece how talking about her helped Ambersong get her new job, as per Ambersong's request. You never heard such pride and love. Our visit to DC a few weeks ago was not the stress free weekend away I'd hoped it would be, but both girls bonded amazingly with Ambersong. I think Maraena likes her better than she likes me. Mom is on that bandwagon too, at least she certainly was tonight.

I had a theory about something that happpened last year and even at the time when I was thinking it was happening I kept thinking it was a wee bit paranoid. What do you do when you find out your paranoid delusions are 100% accurate? If this were a Call of Cthulu game I think I would have gained SAN. Which brings us to the question of the day, if you have a paranoid delusion that turns out to be true,what does that do to your future chances of sane stablility?

Here's hoping mom is as recovered tomorrow as her nurses mistakenly believed she was today.

Thank you for the well wishes I've gotten for her and my family and myself. Each and every one of them was a sincere comfort.

-WF

Her mind "re-boots" every time she goes to sleep. It's like she running a buggy Windows OS and her last good save point was Monday at 7:20 PM. If this continues she may  need 24/7 care, hopefully not though. Hopefully they'll find a perfect cocktail of medication that lets her retain short term memories. She was one of the brightest people I've ever met. I'm not saying that because she's my mom. She could intelligently discuss the works of Joyce, Shakespeare and Ayn Rand. She understood the theories of Jung, Freud, and Skinner. She could fix an oil burner and cook a gourmet meal. She regularly beat me at Scrabble, something only Ambersong can do with any regularity. To see her mind thus reduced is an indignity that makes me question the existence of God, except she taught me that God is beyond my comprehension, too much to fully understand we can only catch glimpses of his shadow as he works behind the scenes. If there is anything about me that you've ever liked or admired, it came from her.

Mom took a turn for the worse over night but recovered early this afternoon. The client bailed on the deal that should have closed yesterday afternoon but wants to think about bringing the consultant on for a new role instead. Strap yourself in I think this week's ride is just getting started.

Had an ambulance take mom to the Emergency room last night. Not fun. 

Thank you Ambersong for being you last night. It definitely helped. Hopefully they'll be letting her come home today. We shall see.

I made an early meeting at work today, and things here are going well. The more I talk to and meet other people, the more sure I am of what direction I want various aspects of my life to go in. The weight loss and the other physical improvements are going to continue, as is working hard at my job and being there on time and enthusiastic every single day. 

Even when circumstantial events lend themselves to my defeat, I'll persevere. I'm too stubborn not to. The events of last night have steeled my resolve to have the good life I want to have and  to do whatever it takes to see that through.

Also I need more webkinz.

-WF

"Give me the wisdom to do what is right and just. And make me an instrument of your will." 














--Barack Obama

You are The Magician

Skill, wisdom, adaptation. Craft, cunning, depending on dignity.

Eleoquent and charismatic both verbally and in writing, you are clever, witty, inventive and persuasive.

The Magician is the male power of creation, creation by willpower and desire. In that ancient sense, it is the ability to make things so just by speaking them aloud. Reflecting this is the fact that the Magician is represented by Mercury. He represents the gift of tongues, a smooth talker, a salesman. Also clever with the slight of hand and a medicine man - either a real doctor or someone trying to sell you snake oil.

What Tarot Card are You?
Take the Test to Find Out.

It's been replaying in my head all morning. What I did, what I heard, who I was with, over and over again. It may be like this every year. How much worse for those who were actually there.

Count your blessings today, and take no one for granted. raise a toast to the United States of America and to the confounding of her enemies.

-WF

So it seems thinking good thoughts can work...

-WF

Congrats!!!

So it turns out a colleague of mine from back in the day became a serial bank robber last year. he had a cute nickname and he robbed over a dozen banks for a grand total of around $60,000.00. He'll go to jail now for 20 years. When he gets out he'll be beyond retirement age. He was in debt and his home and his vacation condo were in foreclosure and he owed a lot of credit card debt. 

Utterly bizarre.

Good inspiration to work harder at my job however. Twenty years for $60,000.00 comes out to $3k a year.  Crime clearly doesn't pay... at least not enough. Speaking of jobs, still waiting on Ambersong's feedback after the interview.

Hope things are going well for her and all of you.

-WF

Ambersong has an interview for a teaching job in CT tomorrow. While I'm not sure I believe having groups of people wishing her well will help, it certainly can't hurt. So think good thoughts.

-WF

In the past I've done this fairly often. Did it yesterday. Only hurts a little when you fully extend it.

Had a weird weekend in some ways. Perfectly normal one in others.

Closing deals like ringing bells over here. Really liking the new job.

Very happy with Trollhattan too.  

The convention bounce is favoring the Republicans, they not only over came the bounce the Dems had but bested it. On average (according to RealClear Politics) McCain now leads nationally by 1% across all major polls. Obama has abandoned his ad buys in Georgia and the whole shooting match will now come down to 4 states; Ohio, Michigan, Florida and Pennsylvania. This will not be good news for Obama.  He needs to stop engaging with quips and cute sound bites. He's not going to win on Charisma. And he's had to apologize for too many of them lately because his handlers have underestimated how likable Sarah Palin is and how seriously most people take the issue of reproductive rights vs. the right to life. He needs some detailed policy that can be seen as effective that isn't obviously a rehashing of something Edwards or Clinton came up with. 

-WF

Somehow I missed MN's birthday. Sorry about that, Happy Birthday.

-WF

Obama claims he has more executive experience than Sarah Palin because he has been running for President for 18 months.  I think he's having a drug flashback.  First... he isn't running his campaign, David Plouffe is. Second the worst thing that happens if he screws up (like he did by saying this) is he doesn't get to be president. That really doesn't compare with being a Governor of what would be the 19th largest country in the world if it were a country instead of the largest state in the union. Also...  18 months is less than 24... he needs to re-work some basic math skills there. Although using his logic, clearly John McCain is much more qualified to be President since this is the third time he's running.

It's not the first night like this, but on the bright side it's definitely one closer to the last.

Job is busy,which is good. I've got so many things on the verge of closing that I'm sure I'll close something tomorrow or Monday.

Tried to register my new car today and failed. The seller signed his name in the box that read "Seller's Name" instead of the one directly below it that read "Seller's Signature." Also the DMV wants me to get a clearance letter from the town for the property tax on my truck from last year. There are two probems with that. First,I haven't owned that truck in 4 years, second the tax collector's office isn't open on Saturday morning's anymore. So I'd have to take time off a job that I'm still in the "probationary" period of in order to get a letter from a tax collector about something I don't actually owe them. That seems unlikely to be something I can get them to do on the phone, and even if I could, how could I get the letter in time to go to DMV on Saturday? I can't call in "at the tax collector" tomorrow morning. I have an interview to conduct at 9:15. And client interviews to follow up on all morning.

Read a good poem about Schrodingers cat this week, which had a great perspective on traditional gender roles. It was written by one of my favorite writers. Spent some quality family time with my nephew for his birthday. He's a good little guy, I'm glad I got to see him. 

Picture this, you're tied to a post and Billy Zane is hitting you in the face with a live turtle. After hours of this your face is bloody and abraded, your nose and teeth are broken. It's pretty obvious how this treatment is making you feel. Then Billy asks you, without pausing in his terrapinic assult, if it would help to talk about it and what he could do to make everything ok. 

Obviously that sort of thing doesn't actually happen. Billy Zane would never risk harming a turtle like that, and he's unlikely to hurt you like that either. After all, he's a pretty cool dude.

Great lyric by Elvis Costello "You were the spice of life, the gin in my vermouth."  What makes it great of course is that the natural relationship of gin to vermouth, in their natural co-habitative environment the martini, is a lot of gin to very little vermouth. How little vermouth you ask?  To make the classic dry martini, you fill a shaker with ice, you pour in one shot of vermouth, shake it till the ice is coated in vermouth, then strain the excess vermouth out. Next you fill he shaker with gin, and stir it in the ice gently, allowing just a hint of the vermouth to combine with the gin. You then strain the vermouth laced gin into a chilled martini glass and add a  little plastic sword with three olives to the glass. Voila, a classic martini. 

Been listening to Echo and the Bunnymen tonight, not sure if that has hidden meanng or not, but these lyrics popped out at me:

Seven seas
Swimming them so well
Glad to see
My face among them
Kissing the tortoise shell


Makes me wonder about Billy drinking a martini from a bloody turtle shell and armies of coneys attacking sleeping bears. Important safety tip, don't poke the bear.

Yeah, Insomnia... it's as much fun as it seems.

"If little faults proceeding on distemper shall not be winked at, how shall we stretch our eye, when capital crimes, chewed, swallowed and digested appear before us?"

Billy the Bard

It's been a weird week.

243 and losing still.

Brett Favre is a Jet.

An old friend put a lot of things into much better focus.

A Saab rose, phoenix-like from the ashes of it's own demise.

I was violently ill, but managed to mask it well enough to hide it from my co-workers.

Being the guy who's right isn't necessarily as much fun as you'd think.

I look better with a thinner face.

You don't treat people the way you want to be treated because it's profitable, or because you expect some karmic payback. You do it because it's the right thing to do. Cruelty and vengeance are not justice, you should strive to not confuse them for it.

A justice system that puts chauffuers in prison because the prosecution convinced 3 out of 5 guys the prisoner was probably guilty of something... is not really justice.

4 pounds from now... I'll start running again.

New nickname at work: Mensa
Best nickname at work: K-Rock, unfortunately it's not mine.

Honest Tea is really freakin good.

-WF

In literature there's a technique where the weather is aligned with the events that are transpiring and how the main character feels. It's common in gothic literature. In real life, not so much. Or perhaps in real life, it's tougher to figure out who the main character is.

The bank partially fixed their mistake, they'll finish fixing it tomorrow after their mistake is complete. At least I'm back to positive funds now though.

Ambersong asked what "Bolgia" are. They are the sub-regions of the lower circles of hell in Dante's Inferno. I find it interseting that people who try to predict the future, but are not divinely inspired go there. It's  part of hell that is being populated with Weathermen.

-WF
